bacLevelInfo.bac02: No loss of coordination, slight euphoria, and loss of shyness. Relaxation, but depressant effects are not apparent.
bacLevelInfo.bac04: Feeling of well-being, relaxation, lower inhibitions, and sensation of warmth. Euphoria. Some minor impairment of judgment and memory, lowering of caution.
bacLevelInfo.bac06: Slight impairment of balance, speech, vision, reaction time, and hearing. Euphoria. Reduced judgment and self-control. Impaired reasoning and memory.
bacLevelInfo.bac10: Significant impairment of motor coordination and loss of good judgment. Speech may be slurred; balance, peripheral vision, reaction time, and hearing will be impaired.
bacLevelInfo.bac13: Gross motor impairment and lack of physical control. Blurred vision and major loss of balance. Euphoria is reducing and beginning dysphoria (a state of feeling unwell)
bacLevelInfo.bac16: Dysphoria predominates, nausea may appear. The drinker has the appearance of a sloppy drunk.
bacLevelInfo.bac20: Needs assistance in walking; total mental confusion. Dysphoria with nausea and vomiting; possible blackout.
bacLevelInfo.bac40: Onset of coma, possible death due to respiratory arrest.
